Dropkick.name: Dropkick
Dropkick.description:
# Getting started
After you've cloned the repo you will need to add the library to your page. In the `build/js` folder use
one of the two DropKick files given. One has a version number in the file name and the other is a version
number-less version. You will also need to grab the css from `build/css` and load it on the page.

Once those files are imported into the page you can call DropKick on any HTMLSelectElement:
`new Dropkick( HTMLSelectElement, Options );` or `new Dropkick( "ID", Options );`. This returns the dropkick
object to you. It may be useful for you to store this in a var to reference later.

If you're using jQuery you can do this instead:
`$('#select').dropkick( Options );`

return.description: DropKick Object for that select. You can call your methods on this if stored in a var

params.name: options
params.description: See list of [properties you can pass in here](#list_of_properties)

classitems.description:
Called once after the DK element is inserted into the DOM.
The value of `this` is the Dropkick object itself.
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description:
Called whenever the value of the Dropkick select changes (by user action or through the API).
The value of `this` is the Dropkick object itself.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Called whenever the Dropkick select is opened. The value of `this` is the Dropkick object itself.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description: Called whenever the Dropkick select is closed. The value of `this` is the Dropkick object itself.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description:
`"strict"` - The search string matches exactly from the beginning of the option's text value (case insensitive).

`"partial"` - The search string matches part of the option's text value (case insensitive).

`"fuzzy"` - The search string matches the characters in the given order (not exclusively).
The strongest match is selected first. (case insensitive).
classitems.name: search

classitems.description:
Adds an element to the select. This option will not only add it to the original
select, but create a Dropkick option and add it to the Dropkick select.
classitems.name: add

classitems.description: Selects an option in the list at the desired index (negative numbers select from the end).
classitems.name: item

return.description: The DK option from the list, or null if not found

example:
```js
   var select = new Dropkick("#select");

   select.item(4); //returns DOM node of index
 ```

classitems.description: Removes the option (from both the select and Dropkick) at the given index.
classitems.name: remove

classitems.description: Initializes the DK Object
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Whether the form is currently disabled or not
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: The form associated with the select
classitems.name: form

classitems.description: The number of options in the select
classitems.name: length

classitems.description: If this select is a multi-select
classitems.name: multiple

classitems.description: An array of Dropkick options
classitems.name: options

classitems.description: An index of the first selected option
classitems.name: selectedIndex

classitems.description: An array of selected Dropkick options
classitems.name: selectedOptions

classitems.description: The current value of the select
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Closes the DK dropdown
classitems.name: close
example:
```js
   var select = new Dropkick("#select");

   select.close(); //closes dk dropdown
 ```

classitems.description: Opens the DK dropdown
classitems.name: open
example:
```js
   var select = new Dropkick("#select");

   select.open(); //Opens the dk dropdown
 ```

classitems.description:
Disables or enables an option; if only a boolean is passed (or nothing),
then the entire Dropkick will be disabled or enabled.
classitems.name: disable

params.name: elem
params.description: The element or index to disable

classitems.description: Selects an option from the list
classitems.name: select

params.name: elem
params.description: The element, index, or value to select

classitems.description:
Selects a single option from the list and scrolls to it (if the select is open or on multi-selects).
Useful for selecting an option after a search by the user.
classitems.name: selectOne

params.name: elem
params.description: The element or index to select

classitems.description:
Finds all options who's text matches a pattern (strict, partial, or fuzzy)

`"strict"` - The search string matches exactly from the beginning of the
option's text value (case insensitive).

`"partial"` - The search string matches part of the option's text value
(case insensitive).

`"fuzzy"` - The search string matches the characters in the given order (not
exclusively). The strongest match is selected first. (case insensitive).
classitems.name: search

classitems.description: Brings focus to the proper DK element
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description:
Resets the Dropkick and select to it's original selected options; if `clear` is `true`,
It will select the first option by default (or no options for multi-selects).
classitems.name: reset

params.name: clear
params.description: Defaults to first option if True

classitems.description:
Rebuilds the DK Object
(use if HTMLSelectElement has changed)
classitems.name: refresh

classitems.description: Removes the DK Object from the cache and the element from the DOM
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description: Builds the Dropkick element from a select element
classitems.name: build

return.description: An object containing the new DK element and it's options

classitems.description: Focus DK Element when corresponding label is clicked; close all other DK's
classitems.name: onDocClick
